node.title: Elon Musk offers to sell more stock after telling Bernie Sanders he forgot 'you're still alive'
node.alt: Elon Musk smiles while holding a phone to his chest, he is wearing a suit
node.description: Tesla chief executive Elon Musk spars with former US presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders, after the latter called for billionaires to pay more tax.
node.content: ["Tesla chief executive Elon Musk is sparring with\u00a0former US presidential hopeful Bernie Sanders, after the latter called for billionaires to pay more tax.", "\"We must demand that the extremely wealthy pay their fair share. Period,\" Mr Sanders, 80, wrote on Twitter.", "\"I keep forgetting that you're still alive,\"\u00a0was the response from Mr Musk, 50.", "The billionaire chief executive, who had already offloaded a combined $US6.9 billion ($9.4\u00a0million) worth of Tesla shares as of November 12, further wrote:\u00a0\"Want me to sell more stock, Bernie? Just say the word.\"", "Mr Musk offloaded the shares after outsourcing the decision to a Twitter poll.", "The Tesla and SpaceX CEO is no stranger to controversy on Twitter.", "In 2019 a\u00a0Los Angeles jury found Mr Musk\u00a0did not defame a British cave explorer when he called him \"pedo guy\" in a tweet.", "Vernon Unsworth, who participated in the rescue of 12 boys and their soccer coach trapped for weeks in a cave in Thailand in 2018, had angered Mr Musk by belittling his effort to help with the rescue as a \"PR stunt\".", "Mr Musk's lawyer had argued that the \"pedo\" slur was an off-hand insult that no-one could be expected to take seriously.", "The tweet from Mr Sanders\u00a0came\u00a0amid the backdrop of Washington's efforts to hike taxes for the super-wealthy.", "US Senate Democrats have unveiled a proposal to tax billionaires' stocks and other tradeable assets to help finance President Joe Biden's social spending agenda and close a loophole that has allowed the super-wealthy to defer capital gains taxes indefinitely.", "Reuters/ABC"]
